With more than 50,000 titles from trusted domestic and international publishers, SmartBook is proud to be the go-to destination for readers who want to keep exploring new ideas.

1.title: Fujiko F. Fujio – Creator of Doraemon
1.content:
Fujiko F. Fujio (1933-1996) is one of Japan's greatest mangaka. He and his series Doraemon created a cultural phenomenon that resonates worldwide.

Early Days

Born in 1933 in Toyama Prefecture, Hiroshi Fujimoto—better known as Fujiko F. Fujio—fell in love with manga early on. In 1951 he met Motoo Abiko (later Fujiko A. Fujio), and the two began working together under the shared pen name "Fujiko Fujio".

The Birth of Doraemon

Doraemon first appeared in 1969 as a secondary character but quickly became the heart of the series, winning fans across the globe.

Cultural Impact

Doraemon is more than a comic—it is a cultural phenomenon translated into many languages and adapted into anime, films, and countless products.

Legacy

Though Fujiko F. Fujio passed away in 1996, his legacy lives on through Doraemon—a symbol of friendship, creativity, and childhood dreams.
